content: Act as a helpful AI assistant
In Julia, Write a function `wrap_string`. It iterates over words and it will add a new line each time a maximum `text_width::Int=10` would be exceeded. Provide an example

Sure! Here's an example of the `wrap_string` function in Julia:

```julia
function wrap_string(input_string::String, text_width::Int=10)
    words = split(input_string)
    current_line_length = 0
    wrapped_string = ""
    
    for word in words
        if current_line_length + length(word) > text_width
            wrapped_string *= "\n$word "
            current_line_length = length(word) + 1
        else
            wrapped_string *= "$word "
            current_line_length += length(word) + 1
        end
    end
    
    return wrapped_string
end
```

Example usage:
```julia
input = "This is a long string that needs to be wrapped"
wrapped_output = wrap_string(input, 10)
println(wrapped_output)
```

This will output:
```
This is a
long
string
that needs
to be
wrapped
```
